concise_definition: v. 击打, 战胜, 心跳; n. 节奏, 敲击声, 巡逻路线

definitions.explanation_en: To strike repeatedly with force, typically using a hand, object, or instrument.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用拳头、物体或工具反复用力击打。
definitions.example_en: He beat the drum with steady rhythm.
definitions.example_cn: 他以稳定的节奏敲打着鼓。

definitions.explanation_en: To defeat someone in a competition, contest, or conflict; to overcome or outperform.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在比赛、竞争或冲突中击败他人，胜过或超越对手。
definitions.example_en: She beat the world champion in the final match.
definitions.example_cn: 她在决赛中击败了世界冠军。

definitions.explanation_en: To pulsate or throb, especially referring to the heart or a rhythmic sound.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有节奏地跳动或搏动，尤指心脏或有节奏的声音。
definitions.example_en: His heart beat rapidly as he waited for the results.
definitions.example_cn: 他在等待结果时心跳加速。

definitions.explanation_en: A regular, repeated pattern of sound or movement, especially in music.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指音乐中规律重复的声音或动作模式，即节奏。
definitions.example_en: The song has a strong beat that makes you want to dance.
definitions.example_cn: 这首歌节奏强烈，让人忍不住想跳舞。

definitions.explanation_en: A regular route or circuit patrolled by a police officer or other official.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指警察或其他官员例行巡逻的固定路线。
definitions.example_en: The officer was on his nightly beat when he spotted the suspicious figure.
definitions.example_cn: 警察在夜间巡逻时发现了那个可疑的身影。

comparison.analysis: “Strike” (打击) 通常指一次性的、突然的击打动作，强调瞬间的冲击力，如闪电击中树木。而 “beat” 更强调重复性、持续性的击打，如敲鼓或心跳，具有节奏感。
“Defeat” (击败) 是更正式、抽象的词汇，专用于竞争或战争中取得胜利，不用于物理击打。而 “beat” 更口语化，既可用于物理击打，也可用于战胜对手，语义范围更广。
“Pulse” (脉搏) 是名词，指心跳或节律性波动的生理现象本身，偏医学或科学语境。而 “beat” 作为名词时更通用，可指音乐节奏或任何有规律的敲击声，语义更宽泛，也更具表现力。
